articles.title: Can Palantir Stock be the Next NVIDIA, and Is It Worth Buying?
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR) has seen its shares rise due to military contracts and expanding commercial AI demand, prompting comparisons to NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA). Despite strong Q1 earnings and increased revenue guidance, the stock's high valuation and potential headwinds like government spending cuts and tariffs raise concerns. Analysts suggest caution, with Palantir currently holding a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell) compared to NVIDIA's Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).

articles.title: NVIDIA and Alphabet’s Intrinsic Put Next-Gen Robotics Within Grasp
articles.summary: NVIDIA and Alphabet's Intrinsic are collaborating to advance autonomous robotic manipulation through the integration of NVIDIA AI and Isaac platform technologies. They are showcasing their work at Automate in Chicago, focusing on robotic grasping and industrial scalability using foundation models enabled by NVIDIA Isaac Manipulator. This partnership aims to make complex robotics tasks more manageable, reduce development costs, and increase flexibility for end-users, demonstrating the impact of foundation models in industrial automation.

articles.title: The 3 Best ETFs to Beat the S&P 500 Through 2030
articles.summary: This article identifies three ETFs poised to outperform the S&P 500 by 2030, emphasizing their low expense ratios, strong historical performance, and alignment with emerging trends. The recommended ETFs are the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH), Invesco S&P 500 Quality ETF (SPHQ), and Invesco S&P MidCap Momentum ETF (XMMO), each offering unique advantages for investors seeking growth and stability.

articles.title: 4 Undervalued Semiconductor Stocks
articles.summary: Despite the AI boom driving up semiconductor stock prices, Morningstar analysts have identified four undervalued semiconductor stocks: Infineon Technologies, STMicroelectronics, MediaTek, and Skyworks Solutions. While digital chipmakers are largely overvalued due to AI, analog/mixed-signal chip valuations are still below fair value estimates. These top picks are favored for their strong positions in automotive semis, leadership in silicon-carbide, expansion into new markets, and essential RF products for mobile devices.

articles.title: Alphabet's First Dividend: What You Need to Know
articles.summary: Alphabet has announced its first-ever quarterly dividend of $0.20 per share, payable on June 17 to shareholders of record as of June 10. While the initial dividend yield will be modest at approximately 0.5%, the company also authorized $70 billion in share repurchases. This move makes Alphabet one of the eight largest US companies by market capitalization to pay a quarterly dividend, alongside a significant share repurchase program.

articles.title: AMD Q1 Earnings Preview: Analysts Bullish, But Warn Of Factors That 'Can Derail The Semiconductor Industry'
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ: AMD) is set to release its Q1 earnings, with analysts expecting revenue of $5.46 billion and earnings of 61 cents per share. While many analysts are bullish due to strong AI MI300 and EPYC performance, they also highlight risks such as market share declines, intense competition, and macroeconomic uncertainties that could impact the semiconductor industry. AMD shares have performed well over the last year, but some analysts have adjusted price targets ahead of the report.

articles.title: NVIDIA to Acquire GPU Orchestration Software Provider Run:ai
articles.summary: NVIDIA announced its definitive agreement to acquire Run:ai, a Kubernetes-based workload management and orchestration software provider. This acquisition aims to help customers optimize their AI computing resources across various environments, with NVIDIA continuing to invest in Run:ai's product roadmap and integrate its capabilities with NVIDIA's AI platforms. The acquisition will enable better GPU utilization and improved management for customers leveraging NVIDIA's accelerated computing platform.

articles.title: Serve Robotics Hauls In $40M and Prepares to Put 2,000 Robots on Streets
articles.summary: Serve Robotics has raised $40 million, bringing its total fundraising to $93 million since 2021, and plans to deploy 2,000 robots in new markets by the end of 2025. The company aims to expand operations in Los Angeles and enter new cities like Dallas, San Diego, and Vancouver, having formalized a partnership with Magna International for manufacturing. Serve highlights safety, labor savings, and adorability as key value propositions, with CEO Dr. Ali Kashani expressing confidence in scalability despite being in early pre-revenue stages.

articles.title: Akamai Launches Cloud Infrastructure and Services Powered by NVIDIA for Enhanced Video Processing
articles.summary: Akamai Technologies has launched a new media-optimized cloud offering leveraging NVIDIA RTX 4000 Ada Generation GPUs to enhance video processing for the media and entertainment industry. This service aims to provide significantly faster encoding and transcoding compared to traditional CPU-based methods, offering scalable and reliable architectures for various demanding workflows. Beyond media, the GPUs are also applicable to generative AI/ML, data analysis, scientific computing, gaming, and high-performance computing.

articles.title: AMD AI chip revenue forecast fails to impress, shares dive 7%
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares fell by about 7% after its forecast for AI chip sales for 2024, at roughly $4 billion, failed to meet Wall Street's expectations, despite being an increase from its prior estimate. The company faces stiff competition from Nvidia in the booming AI server semiconductor market and is experiencing weakness in traditional server, gaming, and embedded segments. AMD also reported first-quarter revenue that slightly beat estimates and provided a second-quarter revenue forecast in line with analyst expectations.

articles.title: An AI-focused ETF from a hedge fund veteran is gaining attention by soaring 60% over the past year
articles.summary: Ivana Delevska's Spear Alpha ETF (SPRX), an AI-focused fund, has gained attention by soaring over 60% in the past year, significantly outperforming Cathie Wood's Ark Innovation ETF. Delevska, a hedge fund veteran, credits her early identification of the AI boom through extensive industrial sector research. The ETF, with $70 million in assets and about 26 holdings, has an almost 11% weighting in Nvidia, which contributed significantly to its outperformance.

articles.title: Nvidia and 3 More AI Stocks With New 'Outperform' Ratings
articles.summary: The article highlights Nvidia and three other AI chip stocks—Microchip Technology, NXP Semiconductors, and Impinj—that have recently received "Outperform" ratings from Evercore ISI Group. It delves into their financial performance, market positions, analyst ratings, and future growth prospects, particularly in the context of the burgeoning AI and IoT markets. The analyst Mark Lipacis projects significant growth and margin expansion for these companies.

articles.title: Alphabet's First Dividend: What You Need to Know
articles.summary: Alphabet announced its first-ever quarterly dividend of US$0.20 per share, following a similar move by Meta Platforms. This initial dividend will result in a modest yield of approximately 0.5% for Alphabet shares, significantly less than its historical buyback yield. While the new dividend rate represents only 12% of morningstar equity analyst's earnings per share forecast, leaving substantial room for future increases, share repurchases are expected to outweigh dividends in the near term.

articles.title: Advanced Packaging Market Aims for Remarkable Growth, Targeting USD 79.9 Billion by 2033 at 8.4% CAGR
articles.summary: The advanced packaging market is projected to grow from USD 35.7 billion in 2023 to USD 79.9 billion by 2033, achieving an 8.4% CAGR. This growth is driven by the increasing demand for miniaturization of devices and advanced packaging solutions for integrated circuits in various sectors, especially consumer electronics and automotive. The Asia Pacific region is anticipated to dominate the market due to its prominent semiconductor manufacturing industry.

articles.title: Consider This Award-Winning Disruptive Tech ETF
articles.summary: The article highlights the Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF (FDTX), an award-winning actively managed fund providing exposure to disruptive tech companies. FDTX recently won the Best New U.S. Equity ETF award at the 2024 etf.com Awards and targets companies in areas like big data, cybersecurity, and AI. The fund's top holdings include Nvidia, Salesforce, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing.
